name: Escape The Seven Seas
description:
(If you play the game on the browser, ensure you click on the game window with the mouse to be able to play - controls below, but also partially explained during the game)

Arrr... you be a pirate... And you got your soul stolen, so the only reasonable thing to do is to get it back... Will you be able to?

You set sail to cross the seven seas and face many dangers. Will you be able to defeat the dangers that await you?

This game was programmed for the #32nd Edition of the Godot Wild Jam and the majority of the resources was created between the beginning and the end of this GameJam. All the programming was done during this time period.

Controls:

(The controls are explained in the course of the game - remember that you will only unlock certain features in the course of the game, but the following is a breakdown of the controls, provided you have unlocked all features)

Keys "W" or "D": Move Left / Move Right

>> Keyboard: "Arrow-left", "Arrow-right": Move to the left or right

>> Controller: "Digipad left", "Digipad right": Move to the left or right

Key "S":  Crouch

>> Keyboard; "Arrow down"

>> Controller: Digipad down(or arrow-down): Crouch

Key "K": Jump

>> Keyboard "K" >> Controller: "Lower action button"

Key "J": Hit / Collect Resources / Repair / Heal

>> Keyboard: "J"

>> Controller: "Left action button"

Key "I" / "L": Shoot Bullets / Throw Throwing Knives

>> Keyboard: "I" / "J"

>> Controller "Upper action button", "Right action button"

Key "U" / "O": Speed Down / Speed Up Ship

>> Keyboard: "U" / "O"

>> Controller: "L2" / R2"

Key "Q" / "E": Draw / Sheath Weapons

>> Keyboard "Q" / "E"

>> Controller "L" / "R"

Key "Escape": Mute Music

>> Keyboard: "ESC"

>> Controller: "Start"

Key "V": Reset

>> Keyboard: "V"

>> Controller: "SELECT"

I have invested as much time into this project during these almost 1.5 weeks as I could, but I had so many more ideas to implement, that I didn't get around to implementing.

I hope you enjoy the game and thank you for playing!

- Game made by Maik Schmidt,
aka CroSnake
